page.title: 06COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: In this area of E.Cornwall there is one Sub-Post Office at STOKE CLIMSLAND the oldest working Sub-Post Office in Britain,established in 1839.The building itself dates from1287,when it was built as a mason's dwelling during the construction of the Parish Church. 1oo pension books and 7o Family Allowance books are dealt with every week.There are two mail collections at 11,oo a.m. and 3.oo p.m.each day,and one delivery each morning.The Leicestershire Building Society has a branch agency at the Post Office,and the building also houses the Village Store.The owners serve the village in many other ways,selling our Diary of Events,tickets for entertainments,and generally acting as an unofficial Advice Bureau.There are four Public Telephone Boxes,at South Hil,Bray Shop,Venterdon and Stoke Climsland.
